intro: Verbena tweedieana var. arraniana, commonly known as Arran verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Isle of Arran in Scotland. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant violet-blue flowers. The plant typically blooms from June to August, producing clusters of small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy and resilient plant suitable for coastal gardens. Its ornamental value and ecological benefits make it a notable species in local flora.
